Â¶
FUNCTION_BLOCK FINAL Master IMPLEMENTS IMaster, CmpDNP3.IMasterDatabaseCallback, CmpDNP3.IDNP3SessionStatisticsCallback
Function block representing a DNP3 master.
An Master needs to be configured regarding its communication (TCP vs. serial).
Commands
Â¶
Commands can be issued using calls to the Master Commands API - for example
IntegrityPoll
.
Access to datapoint information
Â¶
Datapoint information can be accessed two ways:
calls to Master Datapoints API - for example
AnalogInputGetFromPointNum
using a point observer - for example
AnalogInputPointObserver
Unsolicted responses and integrity data polls / explicit reads
Â¶
Nevertheless there are unsolicted responses, anyone canât rely on them alone - if enabled at all - without integrity data polls or explicit reads to keep the master up to date.
Itâs up to the application to do integrity data polls and / or explicit reads as needed.
Please be aware of the fact, that Object groups 34 âanalog input deadbandsâ, 110 âoctet stringsâ and 115 âextended stringsâ are not in the reply of an integrity data poll,
so explicit reads (additional to integrity data polls) for those Object groups are necessary to update the master accordingly.
Of course this all falls true for eventually existing PointObserver as well, because they get fed by the master.
Contemplate carefully when / how often your application does integrity data polls / explicit reads to avoid unwanted network contention.
As a convenience measure there is an optional automatic request mechanism to update the Master database doing cyclic reads - see MasterConfiguration.SetConfigAspectAutoUpdate().
This mechanism can be configured to some degree, to either read all points of a certain Object group, or just the points relevant for connected PointObserver.
By default it is configured to read Binary* and Counter/FrozenCounter only for PointObservers at 1s cycle, and
Analog*, OctetString and ExtendedString only for PointObservers at 2s cycle.
